intro: Gossypium sturtianum, commonly known as Sturt's cotton, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces fluffy, cotton-like fibers that are used in traditional Aboriginal crafts. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its ecological and cultural significance, it is often found in conservation areas across central Australia.
